definition: side door
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group

sentences.english: Say, several big fellow BangMen went there.
sentences.chinese: 说罢，几个大汉往旁门那边去了。

sentences.english: Can you tell me where it is available?
sentences.chinese: 这种工法怎么能说是旁门左道呢？

sentences.english: Such Confucianism achievement is what you side heresy in the door can compare?
sentences.chinese: 如此儒家功，岂是你们旁门左道所能比拟的？

sentences.english: Take the company of heterodoxy, final meeting becomes his victim.
sentences.chinese: 走旁门左道的企业，最终会成为自己的受害者。

sentences.english: However, his prose was used in order to propel propaganda of a notorious kind.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他的散文却被用来宣传旁门妖道。

sentences.english: The butler who opened the door damned near passed out.
sentences.chinese: 管家开了门，责怪他不走旁门。

sentences.english: Suddenly, from BangMen into several big fellow background .
sentences.chinese: 突然，从旁门闯进后台几个大汉。

definition: dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
lit. devil's gate, crooked path (idiom); corrupt practices/crooked methods/dishonesty
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
access
Buddhism
Daoist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC), based on the teachings of Laozi or Lao-tze 老子[Lao3 zi3] (c. 500 BC-) and Zhuangzi 庄子 (369-286 BC)
to enter the Way/to become a Daoist
heresy
the correct path/the right way (Buddhism)
to execute/the law
see 門第|门第[men2 di4]
depraved life/evil ways/fornication
Taoist external alchemy
lit. true religion/orthodox religion/orthodox Christianity/Islam (in the writing of Chinese or Hui theologians)
to hand down secret knowledge from generation to generation within a school or family etc
Mahayana, the Great Vehicle/Buddhism based on the Mayahana sutras, as spread to Central Asia, China and beyond/also pr. [Da4 cheng2]
